snippet: Tuesday night’s draft lottery has long been a source of optimism for the Knicks, and the good news is that even if they lose out on the top overall pick, they could still be O.K.
abstract: Scott Cacciola On Pro Basketball column holds that NBA draft is so rich with talent that New York Knicks stand to do well even if they miss out on top pick; notes that team has 19.9 percent chance of receiving No 1 pick, and is guaranteed a pick no lower than fifth; observes that draft discussion has centered on two potentially franchise-altering prospects--Karl-Anthony Towns and Jahlil Okafor.
lead_paragraph: Tuesday night’s draft lottery has long been a source of optimism for the Knicks, and the good news is that even if they lose out on the top overall pick, they could still be O.K.

headline.main: An N.B.A. Lottery So Rich, Luck Seems Sure to Favor the Knicks
headline.print_headline: A Lottery So Rich, Luck Seems Sure to Favor the Knicks
